body_html:
Could you double check this is from the latest TensorFlow master branch, and not using a stable binary? This line number 675 for this check seems to be quite old.

F tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:675] Check failed: status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS (3 vs. 0)Unable to find a suitable algorithm for doing forward convolution

Also this line will only be triggered if there is no auto-tuning. But more recent TensorFlow has switched to Autotun by default.

However, even if this is older code, why would this be triggered is still unknown. The return status is "CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAM". That means somehow a bad parameter was passed in.

body:
Could you double check this is from the latest TensorFlow master branch, and not using a stable binary? This line number 675 for this check seems to be quite old. 

F tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:675] Check failed: status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS (3 vs. 0)Unable to find a suitable algorithm for doing forward convolution

Also this line will only be triggered if there is no auto-tuning. But more recent TensorFlow has switched to Autotun by default. 

However, even if this is older code, why would this be triggered is still unknown. The return status is "CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAM". That means somehow a bad parameter was passed in.
